Hello!
We have a slightly different approach to solve the problem:
In the J=
ava mock framework rMock (available at http://rmock.sf.net)
there is a "sta=
ndalone-feature" we call "Dynamic Suites", with which
you build your test s=
uite programmatically. E.g. an
all-classes-in-the-project-path looks like t=
his:

public class AllTests extends DynamicTestSuite {
  public static Test=
 suite() {
    return new AllTests();
  }
  
  public AllTests() {
    supe=
r("All tests");
  }

  protected void setupSuite() {
    forEach(
        i=
s.clazz.assignableTo(TestCase.class)
        .and(is.not(is.clazz.abstr()))=

        .and(is.not(is.clazz.name(is.containing("$"))))
    )
    .in(allC=
lasses())
    .perform(addAllToSuite);
  }
}  

This reads:
"For each item
=
in the allClasses() iterator
that 
is assignable to TestCase
and 
is not ab=
stract
and 
where the class name doesn't contain the "$" string
add the ite=
m to the suite"


Right now this approach has met our needs (run all tests =
in a
project), but yours seem to require a different iterator provider than=

allClasses(), e.g. allClassesInThisPackageRecursively() or
allClassesInThi=
sPackage().

If you need such an iterator or some other feature, please add=
 a
feature request at 
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=3D139732&at=
id=3D744309
We ususally release once a week, and user requests get highest =
priority.

You can read more about dynamic suites on:
http://rmock.sourcefo=
rge.net/dynamicsuites.html

Cheers
